concept.label: State leader in 2014
concept.definition: "State leader in 2014" refers to an individual who held the highest position of power or authority in a sovereign state for some or all of the year 2014. This individual could be a president, prime minister, monarch, or other official depending on the form of government in the particular state. The role of the state leader typically includes making key policy decisions, overseeing the function of the state, and representing the state in national or international affairs. The specific powers and responsibilities of the state leader can vary widely from one country to another, and may be subject to limitations imposed by the country's constitution or other laws.

data.label: ʻAkilisi Pōhiva
data.description: ʻAkilisi Pōhiva (also known as Samiuela ʻAkilisi Pohiva) was a prominent Tongan politician, born on April 7, 1941 in Tongatapu, Kingdom of Tonga and passed away on September 12, 2019 in Auckland, New Zealand due to pneumonia. He held multiple key positions in the Tongan government, notably serving as the State Leader from 2014 to 2019, during which time he also served as the Foreign Minister. Additionally, he was the Minister of Health of Tonga and a Member of the Legislative Assembly of Tonga. Pōhiva was associated with the Human Rights and Democracy Movement and the Democratic Party of the Friendly Islands, and was also a Prisoner or Detainee of Tonga at one point. He studied at the University of the South Pacific. He is noted for being a head of state and government who died in office.
data.rationale: The definition of a "State leader in 2014" is an individual who held the highest position of power or authority in a sovereign state for some or all of the year 2014. The description of ʻAkilisi Pōhiva states that he served as the State Leader from 2014 to 2019. This means that he held the highest position of power or authority in the Kingdom of Tonga during the year 2014. Therefore, based on the provided definition and the information about ʻAkilisi Pōhiva, it can be argued that ʻAkilisi Pōhiva is a "State leader in 2014".

data.label: Armando Guebuza
data.description: Armando Guebuza is a notable individual from Mozambique, born on January 20, 1943, in Murrupula District, Nampula Province, Portuguese Mozambique. He served as the President of Mozambique, a role in which he was very active from 2005 to 2015. Guebuza is also recognized as a government minister of Mozambique and a state leader during various years. He is a member of the FRELIMO party. Not only a political figure, Guebuza is also known for his contributions as a Portuguese-language poet. He was a dignitary at the memorial service of Nelson Mandela and a recipient of the Grand Collar of the Order of Prince Henry. Guebuza is married to Maria da Luz Guebuza. His political career includes his involvement in the RENAMO insurgency from 2013 to 2021. His successor as president was Joaquim Chissano.
data.rationale: According to the provided description, Armando Guebuza served as the President of Mozambique from 2005 to 2015. This time frame includes the year 2014. As President, he would have held the highest position of power or authority in Mozambique, making key policy decisions, overseeing the function of the state, and representing the state in national or international affairs. Therefore, based on the definition provided, Armando Guebuza can be considered a state leader in 2014.

data.label: Miloš Zeman
data.description:
Miloš Zeman is a prominent Czech politician who was born on September 28, 1944, in Kolín, Protectorate of Bohemia and Moravia. He is associated with various political groups including the Party of Civic Rights, the Czech Social Democratic Party, the Civic Forum, the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia, and the Civic Movement. Zeman has served in a number of significant roles such as the Prime Minister of the Czech Republic, the Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies in the Czech Republic and the President of the Czech Republic. He was also a member of the Chamber of Deputies of the Czech Republic and the Chamber of the Nations of Czechoslovakia. 

Furthermore, Zeman was a candidate in the 2003, 2013, and 2018 Czech presidential elections. He has been recognized as a state leader multiple years from 2001 to 2022. Zeman is an alumnus of the Prague University of Economics and Business and identifies as an atheist in politics and law. He was a dignitary at the memorial service of Nelson Mandela and is a recipient of the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany. He is married to Ivana Zemanová.
data.rationale: The definition of a "State leader in 2014" refers to an individual who held the highest position of power or authority in a sovereign state for some or all of the year 2014. The description of Miloš Zeman indicates that he has held significant roles such as the Prime Minister of the Czech Republic, the Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies in the Czech Republic, and the President of the Czech Republic. It also mentions that he has been recognized as a state leader multiple years from 2001 to 2022. Therefore, based on this information, it can be argued that Miloš Zeman fits the definition of a "State leader in 2014" as he held a high position of power in the Czech Republic during that year.

data.label: Nicos Anastasiades

data.label: Beji Caid Essebsi
data.description: Beji Caid Essebsi (also known as Mohamed Beji Caid Essebsi) was a prominent Tunisian politician who served as the President of Tunisia from 2014 until his death in office in 2019. data.label: Joyce Banda
data.description: Joyce Banda (born Joyce Hilda Ntila on 12 April 1950 in Malemia, Zomba, Nyasaland, now Malawi) is a distinguished Malawian woman in politics and a Malawian feminist. She is a prominent figure in Africa, known as the first woman to hold political office in the continent. She served as the President of Malawi, making her one of the few women presidents in Africa. Banda was also elected as a female head of state, head of government, and deputy head of state. She served as a foreign minister from 2006 to 2009 and was a vice president. Banda was a dignitary at the state funeral and memorial service of Nelson Mandela. She is a Chewa by ethnicity and was named among the BBC 100 Women. Banda is married to Richard Banda and studied at Columbus University, Louisiana, Atlantic International University, and Royal Roads University.

data.label: Hassan Rouhani
data.description:
Hassan Rouhani, born Hassan Fereydoun on November 12, 1948 in Sorkheh, Semnan, Iran, is an Iranian politician, scholar, and author who served as the President of Iran from 2013 to 2021. A leading figure of the Iranian Revolution, Rouhani has been involved in the Iranian political landscape in various capacities, including as a lawyer, diplomat, member of the Assembly of Experts, and nuclear negotiator. 

Rouhani is an alumnus of Qom Seminary, the University of Tehran, and Glasgow Caledonian University. He is affiliated with the Moderation and Development Party, the Islamic Republican Party, and the Combatant Clergy Association. Rouhani is also recognized as a Shia Muslim scholar and cleric, and has been involved in several international organizations as a leader. He has received several honours, including the Order of Fath and the Order of Nasr.

Throughout his political career, Rouhani has held numerous positions, including as a member of the Iranian Consultative Assembly, a deputy of Tehran, Rey, Shemiranat and Eslamshahr, and as a candidate in the 2017 Iranian presidential election. He also served as a commander during the Iran-Iraq War and has been involved in various international conflicts as a representative of Iran. Rouhani is married to Sahebeh Rouhani and is known for his book "National Security and Nuclear Diplomacy".
data.rationale: The definition of a "State leader in 2014" refers to an individual who held the highest position of power or authority in a sovereign state for some or all of the year 2014. The description of Hassan Rouhani states that he served as the President of Iran from 2013 to 2021. Given that 2014 falls within this time frame, it can be argued that Hassan Rouhani fits the definition of a "State leader in 2014". As President of Iran, he would have held the highest position of power or authority in Iran, making key policy decisions, overseeing the function of the state, and representing Iran in national or international affairs. Therefore, based on the provided definition and information about Hassan Rouhani, it can be asserted that Hassan Rouhani was a State leader in 2014.

data.label: John Key
data.description:
John Key is a notable figure in New Zealand politics and has held several high-ranking positions. Born in Christchurch, New Zealand on August 9, 1961 as John Phillip Key, he attended the University of Canterbury and Burnside High School. His political career is marked by his leadership in the New Zealand National Party, and he has served as a Member of the New Zealand House of Representatives. Key was Prime Minister of New Zealand and a State Leader for multiple years from 2008 to 2016.

Key has been involved in numerous events and has held numerous roles, including being a political candidate, a dignitary at the memorial service of Nelson Mandela, and a commander during Operation Freedom's Sentinel and the Taliban insurgency. He was also the first leader in the 2008, 2011, and 2014 New Zealand general elections.

He has been recognized as a Grand and Principal Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit and an Honorary Doctor of the University of Canterbury. He is also known as a person of English and Austrian-Jewish descent, and identifies as an agnostic.

Aside from his political career, Key has also been associated with the banking sector, serving as a key person in ANZ Bank New Zealand. His personal controversies and family life are also noted under alternate labels. 

Key is still living, and his contributions and associations are derived from various sources, including multiple Wikipedia articles and categories.
data.rationale: The definition of a "State leader in 2014" is an individual who held the highest position of power or authority in a sovereign state for some or all of the year 2014. The description of John Key clearly states that he was the Prime Minister of New Zealand for multiple years from 2008 to 2016. This means that he held the highest position of power in New Zealand, a sovereign state, during the year 2014. Therefore, based on the provided definition and the information about John Key, it can be argued that John Key is a "State leader in 2014".

data.label: Goh Chok Tong

Goh Chok Tong served as a state leader in the years 2001, 2002, 2003, and 2004. He was educated in the United States, at Williams College, and is a Williams College alumnus. Goh Chok Tong is married to Tan Choo Leng and is identified as an agnostic.

data.label: Konstantinos Stephanopoulos
data.description:
Konstantinos Stephanopoulos was a prominent Greek political figure born in 1926 in Patras, Achaea, Peloponnese, Greece. He was an active politician and member of the New Democracy and National Radical Union parties. Stephanopoulos served as Greek MP several times between 1964 and 1989, representing Achaea. He also acted as the Minister of the Interior of Greece and the leader of the Democratic Renewal political group. Stephanopoulos served as the President of Greece both in the 20th and 21st centuries, being a state leader from 2001 to 2005. He was also the commander of Operation Enduring Freedom – Horn of Africa and the Imia operation. 

Stephanopoulos was educated at the National and Kapodistrian University of Athens. He was a recipient of numerous awards and honors, including the Olympic Order, the Order of the White Eagle (Poland), the Order of the Three Stars, the Grand Collar of the Order of Prince Henry, the Collar of the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, and the Grand Cross of the Order of the White Rose of Finland. He also received a key to the city in Canada and made a state visit to Belgium under King Albert II.

Stephanopoulos passed away in 2016 in Athens, Greece from pneumonia. He is remembered as a significant figure in the politics of Greece and has made significant contributions to his nation.
data.rationale: Based on the provided information, there is no evidence to support the assertion that Konstantinos Stephanopoulos was a State leader in 2014. The information states that Stephanopoulos served as the President of Greece and a state leader from 2001 to 2005. However, this does not include the year 2014. Therefore, according to the given information, Konstantinos Stephanopoulos cannot be considered a State leader in 2014.

data.label: Vaira Vīķe-Freiberga
data.description: Vaira Vīķe-Freiberga is a Latvian politician and psychologist recognized for her contributions to both fields. She served as the President of Latvia from 1999 to 2007, and was the first woman to hold this political office in Europe. Vaira Vīķe-Freiberga has also served as the president of the Canadian Psychological Association. Her academic career includes affiliations with McGill University and the University of Toronto. Vīķe-Freiberga has been awarded multiple orders of merit including the Collar of the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, the Order of the Star of Romania, and the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany among others. She has also been recognized as a Fellow of the Royal Society of Canada. She was born on December 1, 1937, in Latvia but later emigrated to Canada where she has also had significant influence.

She is an alumna of McGill University and the University of Toronto, and has also been associated with Concordia University. She became the first female holder of political offices in Europe when she was elected President of Latvia in 1999. 

During her presidency, she was recognized with numerous awards and accolades, including the Collar of the Order of the Cross of Terra Mariana, the Order of the Star of Romania, and the Order of Merit of the Federal Republic of Germany. She has also been acknowledged as a Knight of the Royal Order of the Seraphim and a Grand Cordon of the Order of Leopold. 

In addition to her political achievements, Vīķe-Freiberga has made significant contributions to psychology. She served as the President of the Canadian Psychological Association and is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Canada. She is also recognized as a writer and is listed among prominent Latvian women writers.
